alert.note: Alert for McCreary; Wayne (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 11 at 5:23PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Wayne and southwestern McCreary Counties through 600 PM EDT... At 522 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Mount Pisgah, or 13 miles south of Monticello, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Great Meadows Campsites around 530 PM EDT. Griffin and Rockeybranch around 535 PM EDT. Co-Operative around 540 PM EDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Blue Heron, Whitley City, Marshes Siding, Stearns, Pine Knot, Strunk and Beulah Heights. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1100 PM EDT for south central Kentucky.
